Fever, otitis media, and possible sepsis.context: Fever, otitis media, and possible sepsis.

10-month-old.context: The patient is a 10-month-old male who was seen in the office 1 day prior to admission.

Fever.context: Discharge Diagnoses: 1. Bilateral otitis media. 2. Fever.

Otitis media.context: Admitting Diagnoses: 1. Fever. 2. Otitis media. 3. Possible sepsis.

Possible sepsis.context: Admitting Diagnoses: 1. Fever. 2. Otitis media. 3. Possible sepsis.

Tylenol.context: He has been taking Tylenol and Advil to help decrease the fevers, but the fever has continued to rise.

Advil.context: He has been taking Tylenol and Advil to help decrease the fevers, but the fever has continued to rise.

33 weeks' gestation.context: Significant for being born at 33 weeks' gestation with a birth weight of 5 pounds and 1 ounce.

5 pounds and 1 ounce.context: Significant for being born at 33 weeks' gestation with a birth weight of 5 pounds and 1 ounce.

red and yellow, and opaque bilaterally.context: Tympanic membranes were red and yellow, and opaque bilaterally.

increased workup of breathing.context: He was noted to have some increased workup of breathing and parents returned to the office on the day of admission.

103.6 degrees F.context: He has had a 2-day history of fever that has gone up to as high as 103.6 degrees F.

Tylenol and ibuprofen.context: He was given ceftriaxone 500 mg IV once daily to treat otitis media and possible sepsis, and I will add Tylenol and ibuprofen as needed for fevers.

ceftriaxone 500 mg IV.context: He was given ceftriaxone 500 mg IV once daily to treat otitis media and possible sepsis, and I will add Tylenol and ibuprofen as needed for fevers.

albuterol aerosols.context: His lungs remained clear, but because of the need for O2, we instituted albuterol aerosols every 6 hours to help maintain good lung function.

O2.context: Pulse oximetry checks were ordered every shift and as needed with O2 ordered per nasal cannula if O2 saturations were less that 94%.

D5 and quarter of normal saline.context: Gave D5 and quarter of normal saline at 45 mL per hour, which was just slightly above maintenance rate to help with hydration.

Omnicef 125 mg/5 mL.context: He was continued Omnicef 125 mg/5 mL one teaspoon p.o. once daily and instructed to follow up with Dr. X, his primary doctor, on the following Tuesday.

100% oxygen saturations.context: At the time of exam, he had 100% oxygen saturations on room air with temperature of 99.3 degrees F. with clear lungs.

99.3 degrees F.context: At the time of exam, he had 100% oxygen saturations on room air with temperature of 99.3 degrees F. with clear lungs.

clear lungs.context: At the time of exam, he had 100% oxygen saturations on room air with temperature of 99.3 degrees F. with clear lungs.

afebrile.context: He was at 100% oxygen saturations on room air with no further dips at night. He has become afebrile and was having no further increased work of breathing.

Bilateral otitis media.context: Discharge Diagnoses: 1. Bilateral otitis media. 2. Fever.
